question: The "Story of Wenamun" forms part of which country's ancient literature?
explanation: Story of Wenamun is a historically relevant literary text which forms part of the ancient Egyptian literature. It is also known as the Report of Wenamun or the Misadventures of Wenamun or the Voyage of Unamun. This text is written in a papyrus in hieratic in the Late Egyptian language. This text is now displayed in the Pushkin Museum of Fine Arts, Moscow. The Report of Wenamun (also The Tale of Wenamun), which was long regarded as an official account of an actual voyage but now is recognized as a literary work of impressive achievement. Wenamun dates from c. 1090-1075 BCE in the latter part of the New Kingdom after the golden days of the empire were in the past and Egypt had lost its international prestige. It is a first-person narration of a journey from Egypt to the Levant to get wood for the ship of the god Amun and the many difficulties the narrator experiences along the way; difficulties he feels he would not have known in the days of empire.
